intro: Cephalaria allionii, commonly known as the allionii cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers. Cephalaria allionii is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
